https://image.tmdb.org/t/p/w500/r3jfsMp3pC5m03pQIDsaGnv1JDx.jpg Den of Tigers (2002), by Jonathan Schwartz, lyrically examined the subtle textures of daily life in West Bengal, India. There you could see ankles lifting up and back down into a flooded street, a small ancient woman pushing on the arm of a water pump, and the hypnotic swinging of a young tightrope walkers hips, the image as taut as the narrow rope pressed to her feet. â€“ Genevieve Yue Den of Tigers
